description:
all.bat: report error code back to the gobuilder

not sure that it will work, but.

messages.text:
On 2012/02/10 05:29:02, bradfitz wrote:
> 
> what's the worst that can happen?
> 

That is the attitude! Are you having beer yet?

The worst that can happens, the builder will say OK again. I want it to break. And I am not joking this time.

Alex

No, I have no alternative. So it is your way. Would you like me to send a CL. You would have to update builders before we run it anyway.

Alex

LGTM

what's the worst that can happen?

> No, I have no alternative. So it is your way. Would you like me to send

I will send you a builder CL if you send me an all.bat CL.

On Fri, Feb 10, 2012 at 01:21,  <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:

ok

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=bbb1856e41e2 ***

all.bat: report error code back to the gobuilder

not sure that it will work, but.

R=golang-dev, bradfitz
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5649051

LGTM

If I run all.bat at a command prompt now, does this make the command prompt exit?  I've never understood when exit does that and when it doesn't.

On 2012/02/10 06:19:58, rsc wrote:
> 
> I will send you a builder CL if you send me an all.bat CL.

Why no one CL?

Alex

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

On Fri, Feb 10, 2012 at 00:53,  <alex.brainman@gmail.com> wrote:
> This is how it works here:
>
> exit 1: returns exit code 1 and does exits command prompt
>
> exit /b 1: returns exit code 0 and exits command prompt
>
> Neither is what we want. Is it?

No.  Maybe the builder should set an environment
variable like GOBUILDEXIT=1.

if x%GOBUILDEXIT%==x1 exit %GOBUILDFAIL%

?

On 2012/02/10 05:44:52, rsc wrote:
> If I run all.bat at a command prompt now, does this make the command prompt
> exit?  I've never understood when exit does that and when it doesn't.

This is how it works here:

exit 1: returns exit code 1 and does exits command prompt

exit /b 1: returns exit code 0 and exits command prompt

Neither is what we want. Is it?

Alex

On 2012/02/10 06:00:42, rsc wrote:
> ...  Maybe the builder should set an environment
> variable like GOBUILDEXIT=1.
> 
> if x%GOBUILDEXIT%==x1 exit %GOBUILDFAIL%
> 

Sounds like a plan. But let me try something else first. I will let you know.

Alex

subject: code review 5649051: all.bat: report error code back to the gobuilder
